sinaiticus.text: And after these things he went out, and saw a publican named Levi sitting at the custom-house, and said to him: Follow me.

sinaiticus.text: And leaving all, he arose and followed him.

verses.text: And leaving all, he arose and followed him.

sinaiticus.text: And Levi made him a great feast in his house; and there was a great multitude of publicans and others who were reclining at table with them.

verses.text: And Levi made him a great feast in his house; and there was a great multitude of publicans and others who were reclining at table with them.

sinaiticus.text: And the Pharisees and their scribes murmured against his disciples, saying: Why do you eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

verses.text: And the Pharisees and their scribes murmured against his disciples, saying: Why do you eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: They that have health have no need of a physician, but they that are sick;

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: They that have health have no need of a physician, but they that are sick;

sinaiticus.text: I have not come to call righteous men, but sinners, to repentance.

verses.text: I have not come to call righteous men, but sinners, to repentance.

sinaiticus.text: And they said to him: The disciples of John fast often and make prayers; likewise also those of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink.

verses.text: And they said to him: The disciples of John fast often and make prayers; likewise also those of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus said to them: Can you make the sons of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

verses.text: But Jesus said to them: Can you make the sons of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

sinaiticus.text: But days will come; and when the bridegroom shall have been taken away from them, then shall they fast in those days.

verses.text: But days will come; and when the bridegroom shall have been taken away from them, then shall they fast in those days.

sinaiticus.text: And he spoke also a parable to them: No one tears a piece from a new garment and puts it on an old garment; otherwise, both the new makes a rent, and the piece that is from the new agrees not with the old.

verses.text: And he spoke also a parable to them: No one tears a piece from a new garment and puts it on an old garment; otherwise, both the new makes a rent, and the piece that is from the new agrees not with the old.

sinaiticus.text: And no one puts new wine into old bottles; otherwise, the new wine bursts the bottles, and itself is spilled, and the bottles perish;

verses.text: And no one puts new wine into old bottles; otherwise, the new wine bursts the bottles, and itself is spilled, and the bottles perish;

sinaiticus.text: but new wine must be put into new bottles.

verses.text: but new wine must be put into new bottles.

sinaiticus.text: And no one after drinking old, desires new; for he says: The old is good.

verses.text: And no one after drinking old, desires new; for he says: The old is good.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass, on the first sabbath after the second day of the feast, that he went through the fields of grain, and his disciples pulled the ears of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.

verses.text: And it came to pass, on the first sabbath after the second day of the feast, that he went through the fields of grain, and his disciples pulled the ears of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.

sinaiticus.text: But some of the Pharisees said: Why do you that which it is not lawful to do on the sabbath?

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said: Why do you that which it is not lawful to do on the sabbath?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: Have you not read this that David did, when he was hungry, himself and those that were with

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: Have you not read this that David did, when he was hungry, himself and those that were with

sinaiticus.text: How he entered into the house of God, and took the loaves of the presence, and ate and gave also to those that were with him, which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

verses.text: How he entered into the house of God, and took the loaves of the presence, and ate and gave also to those that were with him, which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: The Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

verses.text: And he said to them: The Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass on another sabbath that he went into the synagogue and taught. And a man was there, and his right hand was withered.

verses.text: And it came to pass on another sabbath that he went into the synagogue and taught. And a man was there, and his right hand was withered.

sinaiticus.text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him if he would cure on the sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.

verses.text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him if he would cure on the sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.

sinaiticus.text: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man that had the withered hand: Rise and stand in the midst. And he arose and stood.

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man that had the withered hand: Rise and stand in the midst. And he arose and stood.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to them: I ask you if it is lawful on the sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy.

verses.text: And Jesus said to them: I ask you if it is lawful on the sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy.

sinaiticus.text: And looking around on them all, he said to him: Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so, and his hand was restored.

verses.text: And looking around on them all, he said to him: Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so, and his hand was restored.

sinaiticus.text: But they were filled with madness, and conferred one with another what they should do to Jesus.

verses.text: But they were filled with madness, and conferred one with another what they should do to Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass in these days that he went into the mountain to pray; and he spent the night in prayer to God.

verses.text: And it came to pass in these days that he went into the mountain to pray; and he spent the night in prayer to God.

sinaiticus.text: And when day had come, he called to him his disciples, and having chosen from among them twelve, whom he also named apostles,

verses.text: And when day had come, he called to him his disciples, and having chosen from among them twelve, whom he also named apostles,

sinaiticus.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,

verses.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,

sinaiticus.text: and Matthew and Thomas, and James son of Alphaeus, and Simon who is called Zealot,

verses.text: and Matthew and Thomas, and James son of Alphaeus, and Simon who is called Zealot,

sinaiticus.text: and Judas brother of James, and Judas Iscariot who became a traitor;

verses.text: and Judas brother of James, and Judas Iscariot who became a traitor;

sinaiticus.text: and having come down with them he stood in a plain; and a great multitude of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who had come to hear him and to be cured of their diseases;

verses.text: and having come down with them he stood in a plain; and a great multitude of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who had come to hear him and to be cured of their diseases;

sinaiticus.text: and those oppressed by unclean spirits were cured;

verses.text: and those oppressed by unclean spirits were cured;

sinaiticus.text: and all the multitude sought to touch him, for power went forth from him and cured all.

verses.text: and all the multitude sought to touch him, for power went forth from him and cured all.

sinaiticus.text: And he lifted up his eyes upon his disciples and said: Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

verses.text: And he lifted up his eyes upon his disciples and said: Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are you that hunger now, for you shall be filled. Blessed are you that weep now, for you shall laugh.

verses.text: Blessed are you that hunger now, for you shall be filled. Blessed are you that weep now, for you shall laugh.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall shut you out from their society, and shall reproach you, and cast your name out as evil for the sake of the Son of man.

verses.text: Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall shut you out from their society, and shall reproach you, and cast your name out as evil for the sake of the Son of man.

sinaiticus.text: Rejoice in that day and leap for joy; for behold, your reward is great in heaven; for so did their fathers to the prophets.

verses.text: Rejoice in that day and leap for joy; for behold, your reward is great in heaven; for so did their fathers to the prophets.

sinaiticus.text: But alas for you that are rich, for you have your consolation in full.118

verses.text: But alas for you that are rich, for you have your consolation in full.118

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you that are filled now, for you shall be hungry. Alas for you that laugh now, for you shall mourn and weep.

verses.text: Alas for you that are filled now, for you shall be hungry. Alas for you that laugh now, for you shall mourn and weep.

sinaiticus.text: Alas when all men shall speak well of you; for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

verses.text: Alas when all men shall speak well of you; for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you that hear: Love your enemies: do good to them that hate you,

verses.text: But I say to you that hear: Love your enemies: do good to them that hate you,

sinaiticus.text: bless them that curse you; pray for them that insult you.

verses.text: bless them that curse you; pray for them that insult you.

sinaiticus.text: To him that smites thee on the cheek offer the other also; and from him that takes from thee thy mantle, thy coat also withhold not.

verses.text: To him that smites thee on the cheek offer the other also; and from him that takes from thee thy mantle, thy coat also withhold not.

sinaiticus.text: Give to every one that asks of thee; and from him that takes away thy goods ask them not again.

verses.text: Give to every one that asks of thee; and from him that takes away thy goods ask them not again.

sinaiticus.text: And as you would that men should do to you, do you also to them in like manner.

verses.text: And as you would that men should do to you, do you also to them in like manner.

sinaiticus.text: And if you love them that love you, what thanks have you? for sinners love those that love them.

verses.text: And if you love them that love you, what thanks have you? for sinners love those that love them.

sinaiticus.text: For if you do good to those that do good to you, what thanks have you? even sinners do the same.

verses.text: For if you do good to those that do good to you, what thanks have you? even sinners do the same.

sinaiticus.text: And if you lend to those of whom you hope to receive, what thanks have you? even sinners lend to sinners that they may receive the same.

verses.text: And if you lend to those of whom you hope to receive, what thanks have you? even sinners lend to sinners that they may receive the same.

sinaiticus.text: But love your enemies and do good and lend, hoping for nothing in return; and your reward shall be great, and you shall be sons of the Highest; for he is kind to the unthankful and the evil.

verses.text: But love your enemies and do good and lend, hoping for nothing in return; and your reward shall be great, and you shall be sons of the Highest; for he is kind to the unthankful and the evil.

sinaiticus.text: Become merciful, as your Father is merciful.

verses.text: Become merciful, as your Father is merciful.

sinaiticus.text: And judge not, and you shall not be judged; and condemn not, and you shall not be condemned. Release, and you shall be released;

verses.text: And judge not, and you shall not be judged; and condemn not, and you shall not be condemned. Release, and you shall be released;

sinaiticus.text: give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, shall they give into your lap; for with what measure you measure it shall be measured to you again.

verses.text: give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, shall they give into your lap; for with what measure you measure it shall be measured to you again.

sinaiticus.text: And he spoke also a parable to them: Can a blind man lead a blind man? will not both fall into a pit?

verses.text: And he spoke also a parable to them: Can a blind man lead a blind man? will not both fall into a pit?

sinaiticus.text: A disciple is not above the teacher; but every one thoroughly instructed shall be as his teacher.

verses.text: A disciple is not above the teacher; but every one thoroughly instructed shall be as his teacher.

sinaiticus.text: And why beholdest thou l the splinter that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thy own eye?

verses.text: And why beholdest thou l the splinter that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thy own eye?

sinaiticus.text: How canst thou say to thy brother: Brother, let me pull out the splinter that is in thy eye, thyself not beholding the beam in thy eye? Hypocrite, pull first the beam out of thy eye, and then thou shalt see clearly to pull out the splinter that is in thy brother’s eye.

verses.text: How canst thou say to thy brother: Brother, let me pull out the splinter that is in thy eye, thyself not beholding the beam in thy eye? Hypocrite, pull first the beam out of thy eye, and then thou shalt see clearly to pull out the splinter that is in thy brother’s eye.

sinaiticus.text: For there is no good tree that produces corrupt fruit; nor again a corrupt tree that produces good fruit.

verses.text: For there is no good tree that produces corrupt fruit; nor again a corrupt tree that produces good fruit.

sinaiticus.text: For every tree is known by its own fruit; for not from thorns

verses.text: For every tree is known by its own fruit; for not from thorns

sinaiticus.text: The good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth that which is good; and the evil man, out of the evil treasury, brings forth that which is evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.

verses.text: The good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth that which is good; and the evil man, out of the evil treasury, brings forth that which is evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.

sinaiticus.text: But why call me: Lord, Lord, and do not the things that I say?

verses.text: But why call me: Lord, Lord, and do not the things that I say?

sinaiticus.text: Every one that comes to me and hears my words and does them, I will show you to whom he is like.

verses.text: Every one that comes to me and hears my words and does them, I will show you to whom he is like.

sinaiticus.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and deepened, and laid a foundation on the rock; and when a flood came, the stream dashed against that house, and had not strength to shake it; because it was well built.

verses.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and deepened, and laid a foundation on the rock; and when a flood came, the stream dashed against that house, and had not strength to shake it; because it was well built.

sinaiticus.text: But he that hears and does not, is like a man that without a foundation built a house on the earth, against which the stream dashed, and it immediately fell in heaps; and the ruin of that house was great.

verses.text: But he that hears and does not, is like a man that without a foundation built a house on the earth, against which the stream dashed, and it immediately fell in heaps; and the ruin of that house was great.

sinaiticus.text: After he had finished all his sayings in the ears of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

verses.text: After he had finished all his sayings in the ears of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

sinaiticus.text: And a certain centurion’s servant that was dear to him, being sick, was about to die.

verses.text: And a certain centurion’s servant that was dear to him, being sick, was about to die.

sinaiticus.text: But hearing of Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him that he would come and save his servant.

verses.text: But hearing of Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him that he would come and save his servant.

sinaiticus.text: And they came to Jesus and asked him earnestly, saying: He is worthy for whom thou shalt do this:

verses.text: And they came to Jesus and asked him earnestly, saying: He is worthy for whom thou shalt do this:

sinaiticus.text: for he loves our nation, and has himself built for us the synagogue.

verses.text: for he loves our nation, and has himself built for us the synagogue.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus went with them. But when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying: Lord, trouble not thyself; for I am hot worthy that thou shouldst come in under my roof;

verses.text: And Jesus went with them. But when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying: Lord, trouble not thyself; for I am hot worthy that thou shouldst come in under my roof;

sinaiticus.text: wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come to thee; but say in a word, and let my servant be restored to health.

verses.text: wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come to thee; but say in a word, and let my servant be restored to health.

sinaiticus.text: For I am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me; and I say to this one: Go, and he goes; and to another: Come, and he comes; and to my servant: Do this, and he does it.

verses.text: For I am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me; and I say to this one: Go, and he goes; and to another: Come, and he comes; and to my servant: Do this, and he does it.

sinaiticus.text: And when Jesus heard these things he was astonished at him; and turning, he said to the multitude that followed him: I say to you, not even in Israel have I found so great faith.

verses.text: And when Jesus heard these things he was astonished at him; and turning, he said to the multitude that followed him: I say to you, not even in Israel have I found so great faith.

sinaiticus.text: And those that had been sent returned to the house and found the servant well.

verses.text: And those that had been sent returned to the house and found the servant well.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass on the following day he went to a city called Nain; and there went with him many of his disciples and a great multitude.120

verses.text: And it came to pass on the following day he went to a city called Nain; and there went with him many of his disciples and a great multitude.120

sinaiticus.text: And when he came near the gate of the city, behold, there was carried out dead an only-born son of his mother, and she was a widow; and a great multitude of the city was with her.

verses.text: And when he came near the gate of the city, behold, there was carried out dead an only-born son of his mother, and she was a widow; and a great multitude of the city was with her.

sinaiticus.text: And seeing her, the Lord had pity on her, and said to her: Weep not.

verses.text: And seeing her, the Lord had pity on her, and said to her: Weep not.

sinaiticus.text: And coming forward he touched the bier; and those that bore it stopped; and he said: Young man, I say to thee. Arise.

verses.text: And coming forward he touched the bier; and those that bore it stopped; and he said: Young man, I say to thee. Arise.

sinaiticus.text: And the dead man sat up and began to speak; and he gave him to his mother.

verses.text: And the dead man sat up and began to speak; and he gave him to his mother.

sinaiticus.text: And fear seized them all, and they glorified God, saying: A great prophet has risen among us; and, God has visited his people.

verses.text: And fear seized them all, and they glorified God, saying: A great prophet has risen among us; and, God has visited his people.

sinaiticus.text: And this saying concerning him went forth into the whole of Judea, and all the region round about.

verses.text: And this saying concerning him went forth into the whole of Judea, and all the region round about.

sinaiticus.text: And his disciples told John of all these things.

verses.text: And his disciples told John of all these things.

sinaiticus.text: And having called some two of his disciples, John sent to the Lord, saying: Art thou he that comes, or look we for another?

verses.text: And having called some two of his disciples, John sent to the Lord, saying: Art thou he that comes, or look we for another?

sinaiticus.text: And coming to him the men said: John the Baptist has sent us to thee, saying: Art thou he that comes, or look we for another?

verses.text: And coming to him the men said: John the Baptist has sent us to thee, saying: Art thou he that comes, or look we for another?

sinaiticus.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and scourges and evil spirits, and to many blind he gave to see.

verses.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and scourges and evil spirits, and to many blind he gave to see.

sinaiticus.text: And he answered and said to them: Go tell John what things you have seen and heard, that the blind receive sight, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have the gospel preached to them;

verses.text: And he answered and said to them: Go tell John what things you have seen and heard, that the blind receive sight, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have the gospel preached to them;

sinaiticus.text: and blessed is he whoever is not offended at me.

verses.text: and blessed is he whoever is not offended at me.

sinaiticus.text: But when the messengers of John had departed, he began to say to the multitudes concerning John: What went you out into the wilderness to see? a reed shaken by the wind?

verses.text: But when the messengers of John had departed, he began to say to the multitudes concerning John: What went you out into the wilderness to see? a reed shaken by the wind?

sinaiticus.text: But what went you out to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that wear soft clothing and live in luxury are in kings’ houses.

verses.text: But what went you out to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that wear soft clothing and live in luxury are in kings’ houses.

sinaiticus.text: But what went you out to see? a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

verses.text: But what went you out to see? a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

sinaiticus.text: This is he of whom it is written: Behold, I send my messenger before thy face who shall prepare thy way before thee.

verses.text: This is he of whom it is written: Behold, I send my messenger before thy face who shall prepare thy way before thee.

sinaiticus.text: I say to you, among those born of women there is no prophet greater than John; but the least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

verses.text: I say to you, among those born of women there is no prophet greater than John; but the least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

sinaiticus.text: And all the people that heard and the publicans justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John;

verses.text: And all the people that heard and the publicans justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John;

sinaiticus.text: but the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, not having been baptized by him.

verses.text: but the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, not having been baptized by him.

sinaiticus.text: To what then shall I liken the men of this generation, and to what

verses.text: To what then shall I liken the men of this generation, and to what

sinaiticus.text: They are like children that sit in the market and call one to another, saying: We piped to you and you did not dance, we mourned and you did not lament.

verses.text: They are like children that sit in the market and call one to another, saying: We piped to you and you did not dance, we mourned and you did not lament.

sinaiticus.text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say: He has a demon.

verses.text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say: He has a demon.

sinaiticus.text: The Son of man has come eating and drinking, and you say: Behold, a man, a glutton and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners.

verses.text: The Son of man has come eating and drinking, and you say: Behold, a man, a glutton and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners.

sinaiticus.text: And yet wisdom is justified on the part of all her children.

verses.text: And yet wisdom is justified on the part of all her children.

sinaiticus.text: And some one of the Pharisees asked him to eat with him; and he went into the house of the Pharisee, and reclined at table.

verses.text: And some one of the Pharisees asked him to eat with him; and he went into the house of the Pharisee, and reclined at table.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, a woman, who was in the city, a sinner, and had learned that he reclined at table in the house of the Pharisee, brought an alabaster box of ointment,

verses.text: And behold, a woman, who was in the city, a sinner, and had learned that he reclined at table in the house of the Pharisee, brought an alabaster box of ointment,

sinaiticus.text: and stood behind at his feet weeping, and began to moisten his feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

verses.text: and stood behind at his feet weeping, and began to moisten his feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

sinaiticus.text: But the Pharisee that had invited him seeing it, spoke within himself, saying: This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is that touches him, that she is a sinner.

verses.text: But the Pharisee that had invited him seeing it, spoke within himself, saying: This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is that touches him, that she is a sinner.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and said to him: Simon, I have something to say to thee. He replied: Teacher, say on.

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to him: Simon, I have something to say to thee. He replied: Teacher, say on.

sinaiticus.text: A certain creditor had two debtors: the one owed him five hundred denarii, the other, fifty.

verses.text: A certain creditor had two debtors: the one owed him five hundred denarii, the other, fifty.

sinaiticus.text: As they had nothing to pay, he forgave them both. Which of them then would love him the more?

verses.text: As they had nothing to pay, he forgave them both. Which of them then would love him the more?

sinaiticus.text: Simon answered and said: I suppose that he to whom he forgave the more. He said to him: Thou hast rightly judged.

verses.text: Simon answered and said: I suppose that he to whom he forgave the more. He said to him: Thou hast rightly judged.

sinaiticus.text: And turning to the woman, he said to Simon: Seest thou this woman? I entered thy house; water for my feet thou gavest not; but she with her tears has moistened my feet, and with her hair has wiped them.

verses.text: And turning to the woman, he said to Simon: Seest thou this woman? I entered thy house; water for my feet thou gavest not; but she with her tears has moistened my feet, and with her hair has wiped them.

sinaiticus.text: A kiss thou gavest me not; but she from the time I came in has not ceased to kiss my feet.

verses.text: A kiss thou gavest me not; but she from the time I came in has not ceased to kiss my feet.

sinaiticus.text: With oil my head thou didst not anoint; but she with ointment has anointed my feet.

verses.text: With oil my head thou didst not anoint; but she with ointment has anointed my feet.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, I say to thee, her sins which are many are forgiven, because she loved much; but he to whom little is forgiven, loves little.

verses.text: Wherefore, I say to thee, her sins which are many are forgiven, because she loved much; but he to whom little is forgiven, loves little.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to her: Thy sins are forgiven.

verses.text: And he said to her: Thy sins are forgiven.

sinaiticus.text: And they that reclined at table began to say within themselves: Who is this that also forgives sins?

verses.text: And they that reclined at table began to say within themselves: Who is this that also forgives sins?

sinaiticus.text: But as a great multitude had come together, and they were coming to him from every city, he spoke by a parable:

verses.text: But as a great multitude had come together, and they were coming to him from every city, he spoke by a parable:

sinaiticus.text: The sower went forth to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the way, and was trod down, and the birds of heaven ate it up;

verses.text: The sower went forth to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the way, and was trod down, and the birds of heaven ate it up;

sinaiticus.text: and other fell upon the rock, and springing up it withered because it had no moisture;

verses.text: and other fell upon the rock, and springing up it withered because it had no moisture;

sinaiticus.text: and other fell in the midst of thorns, and the thorns grew with it and choked it;

verses.text: and other fell in the midst of thorns, and the thorns grew with it and choked it;

sinaiticus.text: and other fell on the good ground, and springing up it produced fruit a hundredfold. Saying these things, he cried: He that has ears to hear, let him hear.

verses.text: and other fell on the good ground, and springing up it produced fruit a hundredfold. Saying these things, he cried: He that has ears to hear, let him hear.

sinaiticus.text: And his disciples asked him what the parable might be.

verses.text: And his disciples asked him what the parable might be.

sinaiticus.text: And he said: To you is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God; but to the rest in parables; that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

verses.text: And he said: To you is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God; but to the rest in parables; that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

sinaiticus.text: But the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

verses.text: But the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

sinaiticus.text: And they by the way are they that hear; then comes the devil and takes away the word from their heart, lest having believed they should be saved.

verses.text: And they by the way are they that hear; then comes the devil and takes away the word from their heart, lest having believed they should be saved.

sinaiticus.text: And they on the rock are they who when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a time, and in time of temptation apostatize.

verses.text: And they on the rock are they who when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a time, and in time of temptation apostatize.

sinaiticus.text: But that which fell among thorns, are they that hear, and, going forth, are choked by the cares and riches and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

verses.text: But that which fell among thorns, are they that hear, and, going forth, are choked by the cares and riches and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

sinaiticus.text: But that on the good ground, are they that in a good and honest heart having heard the word keep it, and bring forth fruit in patience.

verses.text: But that on the good ground, are they that in a good and honest heart having heard the word keep it, and bring forth fruit in patience.

sinaiticus.text: But no one after lighting a lamp covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a lampstand, that they who come in may see the light.

verses.text: But no one after lighting a lamp covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but puts it on a lampstand, that they who come in may see the light.

sinaiticus.text: For there is nothing concealed that shall not become manifest, neither hid which shall not be known and come into open view.

verses.text: For there is nothing concealed that shall not become manifest, neither hid which shall not be known and come into open view.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed therefore how you hear; for whoever has, to him shall be given; and whoever has not, even that which he seems to have

sinaiticus.text: And his mother and his brothers were coming to him, and were not able to approach him because of the multitude.

verses.text: And his mother and his brothers were coming to him, and were not able to approach him because of the multitude.

sinaiticus.text: And it was told him: Thy mother and thy brothers stand without desiring to see thee.

verses.text: And it was told him: Thy mother and thy brothers stand without desiring to see thee.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said to them: My mother and my brothers are they that hear the word of God and do it.

verses.text: But he answered and said to them: My mother and my brothers are they that hear the word of God and do it.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass on one of the days that he himself entered a ship, and his disciples; and he said to them: Let us go over to the other side of the lake; and they put to sea.

verses.text: And it came to pass on one of the days that he himself entered a ship, and his disciples; and he said to them: Let us go over to the other side of the lake; and they put to sea.

sinaiticus.text: But as they were sailing he fell asleep; and a squall of wind came down on the lake, and they were filled and were in danger.

verses.text: But as they were sailing he fell asleep; and a squall of wind came down on the lake, and they were filled and were in danger.

sinaiticus.text: And coming forward, they waked him, saying: Master, Master, we perish. But he awoke and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water; and they ceased, and there was a calm.

verses.text: And coming forward, they waked him, saying: Master, Master, we perish. But he awoke and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water; and they ceased, and there was a calm.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Where is your faith? But being afraid they were astonished, saying one to another: Who then is this, that he commands both the winds and the water, and they obey him?

verses.text: And he said to them: Where is your faith? But being afraid they were astonished, saying one to another: Who then is this, that he commands both the winds and the water, and they obey him?

sinaiticus.text: And they sailed down to the country of the Gergesenes, which is opposite to Galilee.

verses.text: And they sailed down to the country of the Gergesenes, which is opposite to Galilee.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had come forth to land, there met him from the city a man that had demons; and for a long time he wore no clothing, and abode not in a house, but in the tombs.

verses.text: And when he had come forth to land, there met him from the city a man that had demons; and for a long time he wore no clothing, and abode not in a house, but in the tombs.

sinaiticus.text: But seeing Jesus, he cried out and fell before him, and with a loud voice said: What have I to do with thee, Jesus, Son of God Most High? I beseech thee, torment me not.

verses.text: But seeing Jesus, he cried out and fell before him, and with a loud voice said: What have I to do with thee, Jesus, Son of God Most High? I beseech thee, torment me not.

sinaiticus.text: For he commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man; for at many times it had seized him, and he was bound with chains and fetters, being imprisoned; and breaking the bonds he was driven by the demon into the deserts.

verses.text: For he commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man; for at many times it had seized him, and he was bound with chains and fetters, being imprisoned; and breaking the bonds he was driven by the demon into the deserts.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus asked him, saying: What is thy name? And he said: Legion, for many demons had entered into him.

verses.text: And Jesus asked him, saying: What is thy name? And he said: Legion, for many demons had entered into him.

sinaiticus.text: And they besought him that he would not command them to go away into the abyss.

verses.text: And they besought him that he would not command them to go away into the abyss.

sinaiticus.text: But there was a herd of many swine feeding in the mountain; and they besought him that he would permit them to enter into them. And he permitted them.

verses.text: But there was a herd of many swine feeding in the mountain; and they besought him that he would permit them to enter into them. And he permitted them.

sinaiticus.text: And the demons having come out of the man entered into the swine; and the herd rushed down the steep into the lake and were choked.

verses.text: And the demons having come out of the man entered into the swine; and the herd rushed down the steep into the lake and were choked.

sinaiticus.text: But those who fed them, seeing what had been done, fled and told it in the city and in the country.

verses.text: But those who fed them, seeing what had been done, fled and told it in the city and in the country.

sinaiticus.text: And they came out to see what had been done, and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the demons had gone, sitting,124 clothed and in his right mind, at the feet of Jesus; and they were afraid.

verses.text: And they came out to see what had been done, and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the demons had gone, sitting,124 clothed and in his right mind, at the feet of Jesus; and they were afraid.

sinaiticus.text: And those that saw told them how the possessed with demons had been saved.

verses.text: And those that saw told them how the possessed with demons had been saved.

sinaiticus.text: And all the multitude of the surrounding country of the Gergesenes asked him to depart from them; for they were seized with great fear; and he entered a ship and returned.

verses.text: And all the multitude of the surrounding country of the Gergesenes asked him to depart from them; for they were seized with great fear; and he entered a ship and returned.

sinaiticus.text: And the man out of whom the demons had gone besought him, that he might be with him; but he sent him away, saying:

verses.text: And the man out of whom the demons had gone besought him, that he might be with him; but he sent him away, saying:

sinaiticus.text: Return to thy house, and tell how great things God has done for thee. And he departed, proclaiming throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done for him.

verses.text: Return to thy house, and tell how great things God has done for thee. And he departed, proclaiming throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done for him.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had returned, the multitude received him gladly; for all were looking for him.

verses.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had returned, the multitude received him gladly; for all were looking for him.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, there came a man whose name was Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue; and falling at the feet of Jesus, he besought him to come into his house,

verses.text: And behold, there came a man whose name was Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue; and falling at the feet of Jesus, he besought him to come into his house,

sinaiticus.text: for he had a daughter, an only child, about twelve years old, and she was dying. But as he was going, the multitudes thronged him.

verses.text: for he had a daughter, an only child, about twelve years old, and she was dying. But as he was going, the multitudes thronged him.

sinaiticus.text: And a woman, who had had an issue of blood for twelve years, who had spent her whole living on physicians and could be cured by none,

verses.text: And a woman, who had had an issue of blood for twelve years, who had spent her whole living on physicians and could be cured by none,

verses.text: came behind and touched the fringe of his mantle; and immediately the flow of her blood stopped.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said: Who is it that touched me? And as all denied, Peter and those with him said: Master, the multitudes press on thee and crowd about thee.

verses.text: And Jesus said: Who is it that touched me? And as all denied, Peter and those with him said: Master, the multitudes press on thee and crowd about thee.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus said: Some one touched me; for I perceived power going forth from me.

verses.text: But Jesus said: Some one touched me; for I perceived power going forth from me.

sinaiticus.text: And the woman, seeing that she had not escaped notice, came trembling, and having fallen before him told before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she had been immediately restored to health.

verses.text: And the woman, seeing that she had not escaped notice, came trembling, and having fallen before him told before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she had been immediately restored to health.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to her: Daughter, thy faith has saved thee; go in peace.

verses.text: But Jesus hearing it answered him: Fear not; only believe, and she shall be saved.

verses.text: And taking her by the hand, he called, saying: Child, awake.

verses.text: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal,

sinaiticus.text: But Herod the tetrarch heard of all things that were done, and was perplexed because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,

verses.text: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that a prophet, some one of the ancients, had risen.

sinaiticus.text: And the apostles returned and told him all things that they had done. And he took them with him and withdrew privately to a city called Bethsaida.

verses.text: And the apostles returned and told him all things that they had done. And he took them with him and withdrew privately to a city called Bethsaida.

sinaiticus.text: But the multitudes knew it and followed him; and he received them and spoke to them of the kingdom of God, and healed those that had need of healing.

verses.text: But the multitudes knew it and followed him; and he received them and spoke to them of the kingdom of God, and healed those that had need of healing.

sinaiticus.text: But the day began to decline; and the twelve came and said to him: Send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages and country round about, and lodge and find food; for we are here in a desert place.

verses.text: But the day began to decline; and the twelve came and said to him: Send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages and country round about, and lodge and find food; for we are here in a desert place.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to them: Do you give them to eat. They replied: We have not more than five loaves and two fishes, unless we should go and buy food for all this people.

verses.text: But he said to them: Do you give them to eat. They replied: We have not more than five loaves and two fishes, unless we should go and buy food for all this people.

sinaiticus.text: And they were about five thousand men. But he said to his disciples: Make them recline in table-parties of fifty each.

verses.text: And they were about five thousand men. But he said to his disciples: Make them recline in table-parties of fifty each.

verses.text: And they did so, and made them all recline.126

sinaiticus.text: And taking the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, blessed them and broke, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

verses.text: And taking the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, blessed them and broke, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

sinaiticus.text: And they answered and said; John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; and others, that a prophet, some one of the ancients, has risen.

verses.text: And they answered and said; John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; and others, that a prophet, some one of the ancients, has risen.

verses.text: But he said to them: But who say you that I am? And Peter answered and said: The Christ of God.

verses.text: And charging them strictly, he commanded them to tell this to no one,

sinaiticus.text: saying that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be put to death, and rise the third day.

verses.text: saying that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be put to death, and rise the third day.

verses.text: And he said to all: If any one will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.

sinaiticus.text: For whoever will save his life, shall lose it; but whoever may lose his life for my sake, he shall save it.

verses.text: For whoever will save his life, shall lose it; but whoever may lose his life for my sake, he shall save it.

sinaiticus.text: For what is a man profited if he gain the whole world, but destroy himself or be lost?

sinaiticus.text: For whoever shall have been ashamed of me and my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his glory, and that of the Father, and of the holy angels.

verses.text: For whoever shall have been ashamed of me and my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his glory, and that of the Father, and of the holy angels.

verses.text: And it came to pass as he prayed that the appearance of his face was changed, and his clothing was white and glittering.

verses.text: and they received him not, because his face was going to Jerusalem.

sinaiticus.text: And the disciples James and John, seeing it, said: Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them?

verses.text: And the disciples James and John, seeing it, said: Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them?

sinaiticus.text: But he turned and rebuked them.

verses.text: But he turned and rebuked them.

sinaiticus.text: And they went to another village.

verses.text: And they went to another village.

sinaiticus.text: And as they were going on the way, some one said to him: I will follow thee wherever thou goest.

verses.text: And as they were going on the way, some one said to him: I will follow thee wherever thou goest.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to him: The foxes have dens, and the birds of the heavens have roosts, but the Son of man has not where he may lay his head.

verses.text: And Jesus said to him: The foxes have dens, and the birds of the heavens have roosts, but the Son of man has not where he may lay his head.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to another: Follow me. He replied: Permit me first to go and bury my father.

verses.text: And he said to another: Follow me. He replied: Permit me first to go and bury my father.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to him: Let the dead bury their own dead: but go thou and proclaim the kingdom of God.

verses.text: But he said to him: Let the dead bury their own dead: but go thou and proclaim the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: And another also said: I will follow thee, Lord; but first permit me to take leave of those at my house.

verses.text: And another also said: I will follow thee, Lord; but first permit me to take leave of those at my house.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to him: No one that puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.

verses.text: And Jesus said to him: No one that puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: But after these things the Lord appointed seventy others also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place whither he himself was about to come.

verses.text: But after these things the Lord appointed seventy others also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place whither he himself was about to come.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: The harvest indeed is great, but the laborers are few: pray therefore the Lord of the harvest that he send laborers into his harvest.

verses.text: And he said to them: The harvest indeed is great, but the laborers are few: pray therefore the Lord of the harvest that he send laborers into his harvest.

sinaiticus.text: Go; behold, I send you forth as lambs in the midst of wolves.

verses.text: Go; behold, I send you forth as lambs in the midst of wolves.

sinaiticus.text: Carry no purse, no bag, no sandals: salute no one by the way.

verses.text: Carry no purse, no bag, no sandals: salute no one by the way.

sinaiticus.text: Whatever house you enter, first say: Peace to this house.

verses.text: Whatever house you enter, first say: Peace to this house.

sinaiticus.text: And if a son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it; but if not, it shall return upon you.

verses.text: And if a son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it; but if not, it shall return upon you.

sinaiticus.text: And abide in the same house, eating and drinking such things as they have; for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.

verses.text: And abide in the same house, eating and drinking such things as they have; for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.

sinaiticus.text: And whatever city you enter and they receive you, eat what is set before you,

verses.text: And whatever city you enter and they receive you, eat what is set before you,

sinaiticus.text: and cure those in it that are sick, and say to them: The kingdom of God has come near to you,

verses.text: and cure those in it that are sick, and say to them: The kingdom of God has come near to you,

sinaiticus.text: But whatever city you enter, and they receive you not, go out into

verses.text: But whatever city you enter, and they receive you not, go out into

sinaiticus.text: Even the dust of your city that cleaves to us on our feet we wipe off against you: yet know this that the kingdom of God is near.

verses.text: Even the dust of your city that cleaves to us on our feet we wipe off against you: yet know this that the kingdom of God is near.

sinaiticus.text: And I say to you that it shall be more tolerable for Sodom in that day than for that city.

verses.text: And I say to you that it shall be more tolerable for Sodom in that day than for that city.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for thee, Chorazin; alas for thee, Bethsaida; for if the mighty works which have been done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.text: Alas for thee, Chorazin; alas for thee, Bethsaida; for if the mighty works which have been done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

sinaiticus.text: Furthermore, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment, than for you.

verses.text: Furthermore, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment, than for you.

sinaiticus.text: And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be exalted to heaven? Thou shalt be brought down to hades.

verses.text: And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be exalted to heaven? Thou shalt be brought down to hades.

sinaiticus.text: He that hears you hears me; and he that rejects you rejects me; and he that rejects me rejects him that sent me.

verses.text: He that hears you hears me; and he that rejects you rejects me; and he that rejects me rejects him that sent me.

sinaiticus.text: And the seventy returned with joy, saying: Lord, even the demons are subjected to us in thy name.

verses.text: And the seventy returned with joy, saying: Lord, even the demons are subjected to us in thy name.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: I beheld Satan like lightning from heaven fallen.

verses.text: And he said to them: I beheld Satan like lightning from heaven fallen.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, I have given you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall in any way hurt you.

verses.text: Behold, I have given you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall in any way hurt you.

sinaiticus.text: Yet in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subjected to you; but rejoice that your names are written in the heavens.

verses.text: Yet in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subjected to you; but rejoice that your names are written in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: In that hour he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said: I give thee thanks, Father, Lord of heaven and of earth, because thou hast concealed these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them to babes; yes, Father, for so it seemed good in thy sight.

verses.text: In that hour he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said: I give thee thanks, Father, Lord of heaven and of earth, because thou hast concealed these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them to babes; yes, Father, for so it seemed good in thy sight.

sinaiticus.text: And turning to the disciples, he said: All things have been delivered to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is but the Father, and who the Father is but the Son, and he to whomever the Son will reveal him.

verses.text: And turning to the disciples, he said: All things have been delivered to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is but the Father, and who the Father is but the Son, and he to whomever the Son will reveal him.

sinaiticus.text: And turning to the disciples he said privately: Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

verses.text: And turning to the disciples he said privately: Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

sinaiticus.text: For I say to you that many prophets and kings desired to see what you see, and did not see, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear.

verses.text: For I say to you that many prophets and kings desired to see what you see, and did not see, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, a lawyer stood up tempting him, saying: Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

verses.text: And behold, a lawyer stood up tempting him, saying: Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

sinaiticus.text: And he said to him: What is written in the law? How readest thou?

verses.text: And he said to him: What is written in the law? How readest thou?

sinaiticus.text: And he answered and said: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart, and with thy whole soul, and with thy whole strength, and with thy whole mind, and thy neighbor as thyself.

verses.text: And he answered and said: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart, and with thy whole soul, and with thy whole strength, and with thy whole mind, and thy neighbor as thyself.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to him: Thou hast rightly answered: do this, and thou shalt live.130

verses.text: And he said to him: Thou hast rightly answered: do this, and thou shalt live.130

sinaiticus.text: But he, willing to justify himself, said to Jesus: And who is my neighbor?

verses.text: But he, willing to justify himself, said to Jesus: And who is my neighbor?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus replying said: A man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among robbers, who stripped him and wounded him, and went away, leaving him half dead.

verses.text: Jesus replying said: A man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among robbers, who stripped him and wounded him, and went away, leaving him half dead.

sinaiticus.text: And by chance a priest went down on that road, and seeing him, passed by on the other side.

verses.text: And by chance a priest went down on that road, and seeing him, passed by on the other side.

sinaiticus.text: And in like manner also a Levite, having come to the place, went and looked on and passed by on the other side.

verses.text: And in like manner also a Levite, having come to the place, went and looked on and passed by on the other side.

sinaiticus.text: But a Samaritan on a journey came opposite to him, and seeing him, was moved with pity;

verses.text: But a Samaritan on a journey came opposite to him, and seeing him, was moved with pity;

sinaiticus.text: and going to him, he bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine; and setting him on his own beast, took him to an inn and took care of him.

verses.text: and going to him, he bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine; and setting him on his own beast, took him to an inn and took care of him.

sinaiticus.text: And on the morrow, taking out two denarii, he gave them to the innkeeper and said: Take care of him, and whatever thou spendest more. I on my return will repay thee.

verses.text: And on the morrow, taking out two denarii, he gave them to the innkeeper and said: Take care of him, and whatever thou spendest more. I on my return will repay thee.

sinaiticus.text: Which of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbor to him that fell among the robbers?

verses.text: Which of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbor to him that fell among the robbers?

sinaiticus.text: He replied: He that showed mercy to him. And Jesus said to him: Go, and do thou in like manner.

verses.text: He replied: He that showed mercy to him. And Jesus said to him: Go, and do thou in like manner.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass as they journeyed that he went into a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

verses.text: And it came to pass as they journeyed that he went into a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

sinaiticus.text: And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at the feet of the Lord and heard his word.

verses.text: And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at the feet of the Lord and heard his word.

sinaiticus.text: But Martha was perplexed about much service; and she stood by him and said: Lord, carest thou not that my sister has left me to serve alone? Bid her therefore that she help me.

verses.text: But Martha was perplexed about much service; and she stood by him and said: Lord, carest thou not that my sister has left me to serve alone? Bid her therefore that she help me.

sinaiticus.text: But the Lord answered and said to her: Martha, Martha, thou art anxious and troubled about many things;

verses.text: But the Lord answered and said to her: Martha, Martha, thou art anxious and troubled about many things;

sinaiticus.text: of one however there is need; for Mary has chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

verses.text: of one however there is need; for Mary has chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass as he was in a certain place praying, when he had ceased, some one of his disciples said to him: Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

verses.text: And it came to pass as he was in a certain place praying, when he had ceased, some one of his disciples said to him: Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Whenever you pray, say: Father, thy name be hallowed: thy kingdom come:

verses.text: And he said to them: Whenever you pray, say: Father, thy name be hallowed: thy kingdom come:

sinaiticus.text: give us day by day our needful bread;

verses.text: give us day by day our needful bread;

sinaiticus.text: and forgive us our sins, for we also forgive every one indebted to

verses.text: and forgive us our sins, for we also forgive every one indebted to

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go to him at midnight and say to him: Friend, lend me three loaves,

verses.text: And he said to them: Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go to him at midnight and say to him: Friend, lend me three loaves,

sinaiticus.text: because a friend of mine has come from a journey to me, and I have not what I may set before him.

verses.text: because a friend of mine has come from a journey to me, and I have not what I may set before him.

sinaiticus.text: And he from within shall answer and say: Trouble me not; the door is now closed, and my children with me are in bed: I cannot rise to give thee.

verses.text: And he from within shall answer and say: Trouble me not; the door is now closed, and my children with me are in bed: I cannot rise to give thee.

sinaiticus.text: I say to you, though he will not give him, having risen because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needs.

verses.text: I say to you, though he will not give him, having risen because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needs.

sinaiticus.text: And I say to you: Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and you shall find; knock, and it shall be opened to you.

verses.text: And I say to you: Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and you shall find; knock, and it shall be opened to you.

sinaiticus.text: For every one that asks receives, and he that seeks finds, and to him that knocks it shall be opened.

verses.text: For every one that asks receives, and he that seeks finds, and to him that knocks it shall be opened.

sinaiticus.text: But should a son ask bread of any one of you that is a father, would he give him a stone? or also a fish, would he for a fish give him a serpent?

verses.text: But should a son ask bread of any one of you that is a father, would he give him a stone? or also a fish, would he for a fish give him a serpent?

sinaiticus.text: or should he also ask an egg, would he give him a scorpion?

verses.text: or should he also ask an egg, would he give him a scorpion?

sinaiticus.text: If therefore you being evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the Father who is from heaven give the Holy Spirit to those that ask him.

verses.text: If therefore you being evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the Father who is from heaven give the Holy Spirit to those that ask him.

sinaiticus.text: And he was casting out a demon, and it was dumb; but it came to pass when the demon had gone out the dumb man spoke. And the multitudes wondered;

verses.text: And he was casting out a demon, and it was dumb; but it came to pass when the demon had gone out the dumb man spoke. And the multitudes wondered;

sinaiticus.text: but some of them said: By Beelzebub, the prince of the demons, he casts out the demons.

verses.text: but some of them said: By Beelzebub, the prince of the demons, he casts out the demons.

sinaiticus.text: And others tempting sought of him a sign from heaven.

verses.text: And others tempting sought of him a sign from heaven.

sinaiticus.text: But he knowing their thoughts said to them: Every kingdom divided against itself is made desolate, and house falls against house.

verses.text: But he knowing their thoughts said to them: Every kingdom divided against itself is made desolate, and house falls against house.

sinaiticus.text: And if Satan also has been divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? for you say, that I cast out the demons by Beelzebub.

verses.text: And if Satan also has been divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? for you say, that I cast out the demons by Beelzebub.

sinaiticus.text: But if I cast out the demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.

verses.text: But if I cast out the demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.

sinaiticus.text: But if I by the finger of God cast out the demons, then has the kingdom of God already come upon you.

verses.text: But if I by the finger of God cast out the demons, then has the kingdom of God already come upon you.

sinaiticus.text: When the strong man armed keeps guard over his palace, his goods are in peace.

verses.text: When the strong man armed keeps guard over his palace, his goods are in peace.

sinaiticus.text: But when a stronger than he comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes away all his armor in which he has trusted, and distributes his spoils.

verses.text: But when a stronger than he comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes away all his armor in which he has trusted, and distributes his spoils.

sinaiticus.text: He that is not with me is against me, and he that gathers not with me scatters*. * lit. “scatters me” in Sinaiticus, according to Ehrman.132

verses.text: He that is not with me is against me, and he that gathers not with me scatters*. * lit. “scatters me” in Sinaiticus, according to Ehrman.132

sinaiticus.text: When the unclean spirit has gone out of the man, he goes through dry places seeking rest, and finding none, he says: I will return to my house whence I came.

verses.text: When the unclean spirit has gone out of the man, he goes through dry places seeking rest, and finding none, he says: I will return to my house whence I came.

sinaiticus.text: And he comes and finds it swept and set in order.

verses.text: And he comes and finds it swept and set in order.

sinaiticus.text: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and entering in, they dwell there; and the last state of that man becomes worse than the first.

verses.text: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and entering in, they dwell there; and the last state of that man becomes worse than the first.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass as he said these things, a woman from the multitude lifted up her voice and said to him: Blessed is the womb that bore thee, and the breasts that thou didst suck.

verses.text: And it came to pass as he said these things, a woman from the multitude lifted up her voice and said to him: Blessed is the womb that bore thee, and the breasts that thou didst suck.

sinaiticus.text: But he said: Yes rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God and keep it.

verses.text: But he said: Yes rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God and keep it.

sinaiticus.text: And while the multitudes crowded together, he began to say: This generation is an evil generation: it seeks a sign, and no sign shall be given to it but the sign of Jonah.

verses.text: And while the multitudes crowded together, he began to say: This generation is an evil generation: it seeks a sign, and no sign shall be given to it but the sign of Jonah.

sinaiticus.text: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so shall the Son of man also be to this generation.

verses.text: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so shall the Son of man also be to this generation.

sinaiticus.text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them; for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.

verses.text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them; for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.

sinaiticus.text: The men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.

verses.text: The men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.

sinaiticus.text: No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a secret place, nor under the measure, but upon the lamp-stand, that those who come in may see the light.

verses.text: No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a secret place, nor under the measure, but upon the lamp-stand, that those who come in may see the light.

sinaiticus.text: The lamp of the body is thy eye. When thy eye is simple, thy whole body also is full of light; but whenever it is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.

verses.text: The lamp of the body is thy eye. When thy eye is simple, thy whole body also is full of light; but whenever it is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed therefore lest the light that is in thee is darkness.

verses.text: Take heed therefore lest the light that is in thee is darkness.

sinaiticus.text: If thus thy whole body is full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the lamp by its brightness gives thee light.

verses.text: If thus thy whole body is full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the lamp by its brightness gives thee light.

sinaiticus.text: But while he spoke, a Pharisee asked him to dine with him; and he went in and reclined at table.

verses.text: But while he spoke, a Pharisee asked him to dine with him; and he went in and reclined at table.

sinaiticus.text: And the Pharisee seeing it wondered that he had not first immersed himself before dinner.

verses.text: And the Pharisee seeing it wondered that he had not first immersed himself before dinner.

sinaiticus.text: But the Lord said to him: Now, you Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.

verses.text: But the Lord said to him: Now, you Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.

sinaiticus.text: Senseless men; did not he that made the outside make the inside

verses.text: Senseless men; did not he that made the outside make the inside

sinaiticus.text: But give the contents as charity, and behold, all things are clean to you.

verses.text: But give the contents as charity, and behold, all things are clean to you.

sinaiticus.text: But alas for you Pharisees, for you pay tithes of mint and rue and every herb, and pass by the judgment and the love of God: these ought you to have done and not leave those undone.

verses.text: But alas for you Pharisees, for you pay tithes of mint and rue and every herb, and pass by the judgment and the love of God: these ought you to have done and not leave those undone.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you Pharisees, for you love the chief seat in the synagogues and salutations in the markets.

verses.text: Alas for you Pharisees, for you love the chief seat in the synagogues and salutations in the markets.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, for you are as graves that appear not, and the men that walk over them know it not.

verses.text: Alas for you, for you are as graves that appear not, and the men that walk over them know it not.

sinaiticus.text: And some one of the lawyers answering said to him: Teacher, saying these things, thou reproachest us also.

verses.text: And some one of the lawyers answering said to him: Teacher, saying these things, thou reproachest us also.

sinaiticus.text: He replied: Alas for you lawyers also, for you burden men with burdens hard to be borne, and yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

verses.text: He replied: Alas for you lawyers also, for you burden men with burdens hard to be borne, and yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, for you build the sepulchers of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

verses.text: Alas for you, for you build the sepulchers of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore you are witnesses and you consent to the deeds of your fathers, for they indeed killed them, but you build.

verses.text: Therefore you are witnesses and you consent to the deeds of your fathers, for they indeed killed them, but you build.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore also the wisdom of God said: I will send to them prophets and apostles, and of them they will kill and persecute,

verses.text: Wherefore also the wisdom of God said: I will send to them prophets and apostles, and of them they will kill and persecute,

sinaiticus.text: that the blood of all the prophets, which has been shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

verses.text: that the blood of all the prophets, which has been shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

sinaiticus.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the house: yes, I say to you, it shall be required of this generation.

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the house: yes, I say to you, it shall be required of this generation.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you lawyers, for you have taken away the key of knowledge: you went not in yourselves, and those that were entering you hindered.

verses.text: Alas for you lawyers, for you have taken away the key of knowledge: you went not in yourselves, and those that were entering you hindered.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had gone out thence the scribes and the Pharisees began to be very angry, and to press him to speak of many things,

verses.text: And when he had gone out thence the scribes and the Pharisees began to be very angry, and to press him to speak of many things,

sinaiticus.text: lying in wait to catch something I from his mouth.

verses.text: lying in wait to catch something I from his mouth.

sinaiticus.text: In the meantime, when myriads of the multitude had come together, so that they trod one upon another, he began to say to his disciples first: Beware you of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

verses.text: In the meantime, when myriads of the multitude had come together, so that they trod one upon another, he began to say to his disciples first: Beware you of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

sinaiticus.text: But nothing is concealed which shall not be revealed, and hid which shall not be made known.

verses.text: But nothing is concealed which shall not be revealed, and hid which shall not be made known.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, whatever things you have said in darkness, shall be heard in the light, and what you have spoken in the ear in closets, shall be proclaimed on the housetops.

verses.text: Wherefore, whatever things you have said in darkness, shall be heard in the light, and what you have spoken in the ear in closets, shall be proclaimed on the housetops.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, my friends, be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after this have no more that they can do.134

verses.text: But I say to you, my friends, be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after this have no more that they can do.134

sinaiticus.text: But I will show you whom you shall fear: Fear him who after he has killed has authority to cast into hell. Yes, I say to you, fear him.

verses.text: But I will show you whom you shall fear: Fear him who after he has killed has authority to cast into hell. Yes, I say to you, fear him.

sinaiticus.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings? And yet not one of them is forgotten before God.

verses.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings? And yet not one of them is forgotten before God.

sinaiticus.text: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not: you are of more value than many sparrows.

verses.text: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not: you are of more value than many sparrows.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you: Whoever confesses me before men, him also shall the Son of man confess before the angels of God;

verses.text: But I say to you: Whoever confesses me before men, him also shall the Son of man confess before the angels of God;

sinaiticus.text: but he that denies me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

verses.text: but he that denies me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

sinaiticus.text: And every one that shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him; but to him that blasphemes against the Holy Spirit it shall not be forgiven.

verses.text: And every one that shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him; but to him that blasphemes against the Holy Spirit it shall not be forgiven.

sinaiticus.text: But when they bring you before synagogues, and rulers, and authorities, be not anxious how or what you shall answer in defense or what you shall say;

verses.text: But when they bring you before synagogues, and rulers, and authorities, be not anxious how or what you shall answer in defense or what you shall say;

sinaiticus.text: for the Holy Spirit shall teach you in the same hour what things you ought to say.

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit shall teach you in the same hour what things you ought to say.

sinaiticus.text: But someone from the multitude said to him: Teacher, speak to my brother that he divide with me the inheritance.

verses.text: But someone from the multitude said to him: Teacher, speak to my brother that he divide with me the inheritance.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to him: Man, who appointed me a judge or a divider over you?

verses.text: But he said to him: Man, who appointed me a judge or a divider over you?

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Take heed and beware of all covetousness, for no one has his life in the abundance of the things which he possesses.

verses.text: And he said to them: Take heed and beware of all covetousness, for no one has his life in the abundance of the things which he possesses.

sinaiticus.text: And he spoke a parable to them, saying: The ground of a certain rich man brought forth abundantly.

verses.text: And he spoke a parable to them, saying: The ground of a certain rich man brought forth abundantly.

sinaiticus.text: And he reasoned within himself, saying: What shall I do, for I have not where I shall gather in my fruits?

verses.text: And he reasoned within himself, saying: What shall I do, for I have not where I shall gather in my fruits?
