sinaiticus.text: And he said: This will I do; I will pull down my barns and build greater, and there will I gather in all my produce and my good things;

verses.text: And he said: This will I do; I will pull down my barns and build greater, and there will I gather in all my produce and my good things;

sinaiticus.text: and I will say to my soul: Soul, thou hast many good things laid up for many years: rest, eat, drink, be merry.

verses.text: and I will say to my soul: Soul, thou hast many good things laid up for many years: rest, eat, drink, be merry.

sinaiticus.text: But God said to him: Senseless man, this night shall they require thy soul of thee: but the things that thou hast prepared, whose shall they be?

verses.text: But God said to him: Senseless man, this night shall they require thy soul of thee: but the things that thou hast prepared, whose shall they be?

sinaiticus.text: So is he that lays up treasure for himself and is not rich toward God.

verses.text: So is he that lays up treasure for himself and is not rich toward God.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to his disciples: Therefore, I say to you, be not anxious for your life what you shall eat, neither for your body what you shall put on.

verses.text: And he said to his disciples: Therefore, I say to you, be not anxious for your life what you shall eat, neither for your body what you shall put on.

sinaiticus.text: Consider the ravens, that they neither sow nor reap, which have neither storehouse nor granary, and yet God feeds them: how much better you are than the birds.

verses.text: Consider the ravens, that they neither sow nor reap, which have neither storehouse nor granary, and yet God feeds them: how much better you are than the birds.

sinaiticus.text: But which of you by being anxious can add to his age one cubit?

verses.text: But which of you by being anxious can add to his age one cubit?

sinaiticus.text: If then you can do not even the least, why are you anxious about the rest?

verses.text: If then you can do not even the least, why are you anxious about the rest?

sinaiticus.text: Consider the lilies, how they neither spin nor weave; yet I say to you, not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these.

verses.text: Consider the lilies, how they neither spin nor weave; yet I say to you, not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these.

sinaiticus.text: And if God so clothes the grass that to-day is in the field, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith.

verses.text: And if God so clothes the grass that to-day is in the field, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith.

sinaiticus.text: And you, seek not what you shall eat and what you shall drink, and be not of doubtful mind;

verses.text: And you, seek not what you shall eat and what you shall drink, and be not of doubtful mind;

sinaiticus.text: for all these things the nations of the world seek after; but your Father knows that you need these.

verses.text: for all these things the nations of the world seek after; but your Father knows that you need these.

sinaiticus.text: But seek his kingdom, and these things shall be given you in addition.

verses.text: But seek his kingdom, and these things shall be given you in addition.

sinaiticus.text: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

verses.text: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

sinaiticus.text: Sell your possessions and give charity: make for yourselves purses that grow not old, a treasury unfailing in the heavens, where no thief comes near, neither moth corrupts.

verses.text: Sell your possessions and give charity: make for yourselves purses that grow not old, a treasury unfailing in the heavens, where no thief comes near, neither moth corrupts.

sinaiticus.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

sinaiticus.text: Let your loins be girded and your lamps burning;

verses.text: Let your loins be girded and your lamps burning;

sinaiticus.text: and be you like men awaiting their lord, when he shall return from the marriage, that when he comes and knocks they may immediately open to him.

verses.text: and be you like men awaiting their lord, when he shall return from the marriage, that when he comes and knocks they may immediately open to him.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he comes shall find watching: verily I say to you that he will gird himself and make them recline at table, and coming forth he will serve them.

verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he comes shall find watching: verily I say to you that he will gird himself and make them recline at table, and coming forth he will serve them.

sinaiticus.text: And if in the second, and if in the third watch, he shall come and find them so, blessed are they.

verses.text: And if in the second, and if in the third watch, he shall come and find them so, blessed are they.

sinaiticus.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known at what hour the thief would come, he would not have permitted his house to be broken through.

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known at what hour the thief would come, he would not have permitted his house to be broken through.

sinaiticus.text: And you, be ready, for at an hour at which you think not the Son of man comes.

verses.text: And you, be ready, for at an hour at which you think not the Son of man comes.

sinaiticus.text: But Peter said to him: Lord, to us dost thou speak this parable or also to all?

verses.text: But Peter said to him: Lord, to us dost thou speak this parable or also to all?

sinaiticus.text: And the Lord said: Who then is the faithful steward, the prudent, whom the lord shall appoint over his company of servants to give the measure of food in season?

verses.text: And the Lord said: Who then is the faithful steward, the prudent, whom the lord shall appoint over his company of servants to give the measure of food in season?

sinaiticus.text: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord on coming shall find so doing.136

verses.text: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord on coming shall find so doing.136

sinaiticus.text: Truly I say to you that he will set him over all his goods.

verses.text: Truly I say to you that he will set him over all his goods.

sinaiticus.text: But if that servant shall say in his heart: My lord delays to come, and shall begin to smite the menservants and the maidservants, to eat also and to drink and to be drunken:

verses.text: But if that servant shall say in his heart: My lord delays to come, and shall begin to smite the menservants and the maidservants, to eat also and to drink and to be drunken:

sinaiticus.text: the lord of that servant will come in a day that he looks not for, and at an hour that he knows not, and will cut him asunder, and appoint his portion with the unfaithful.

verses.text: the lord of that servant will come in a day that he looks not for, and at an hour that he knows not, and will cut him asunder, and appoint his portion with the unfaithful.

sinaiticus.text: But that servant that knew his lord’s will, and did not prepare or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes;

verses.text: But that servant that knew his lord’s will, and did not prepare or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes;

sinaiticus.text: but he that knew not, and did things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few. And every one to whom much has been given, of him much shall be required, and to whom much has been committed, of him will they ask the more.

verses.text: but he that knew not, and did things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few. And every one to whom much has been given, of him much shall be required, and to whom much has been committed, of him will they ask the more.

sinaiticus.text: A fire came I to throw upon the earth, and what would I if it were already kindled?

verses.text: A fire came I to throw upon the earth, and what would I if it were already kindled?

sinaiticus.text: A baptism have I to be baptized with, and how am I in pain till it be accomplished.

verses.text: A baptism have I to be baptized with, and how am I in pain till it be accomplished.

sinaiticus.text: Think you that I came to give peace on earth? I tell you no, but rather division.

verses.text: Think you that I came to give peace on earth? I tell you no, but rather division.

sinaiticus.text: For there shall be, from this time, five in one house divided; three against two and two against three

verses.text: For there shall be, from this time, five in one house divided; three against two and two against three

sinaiticus.text: shall they be divided, father against son and son against father; mother against daughter and daughter against mother; mother-in- law against daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against mother-in- law.

verses.text: shall they be divided, father against son and son against father; mother against daughter and daughter against mother; mother-in- law against daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against mother-in- law.

sinaiticus.text: And he said also to the multitudes: When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say that a shower is coming, and so it comes to pass;

verses.text: And he said also to the multitudes: When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say that a shower is coming, and so it comes to pass;

sinaiticus.text: and when you see the south wind blowing, you say that there will be heat, and it comes to pass.

verses.text: and when you see the south wind blowing, you say that there will be heat, and it comes to pass.

sinaiticus.text: Hypocrites, you know how to judge of the face of the earth and of the heaven, but how do you not judge of this time?

verses.text: Hypocrites, you know how to judge of the face of the earth and of the heaven, but how do you not judge of this time?

sinaiticus.text: And why also do you not of yourselves judge that which is right?

verses.text: And why also do you not of yourselves judge that which is right?

sinaiticus.text: For as thou goest with thy opponent-at-law to the ruler, on the way endeavor to be delivered from him, lest perhaps he drag thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the collector, and the collector throw thee into prison.

verses.text: For as thou goest with thy opponent-at-law to the ruler, on the way endeavor to be delivered from him, lest perhaps he drag thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the collector, and the collector throw thee into prison.

sinaiticus.text: I tell thee, thou shalt not come out thence till thou shalt have paid even the last farthing.

verses.text: I tell thee, thou shalt not come out thence till thou shalt have paid even the last farthing.

sinaiticus.text: And he answered and said to them: Think you that these Galileans had become sinners above all the Galileans because they suffered such things?

verses.text: And he answered and said to them: Think you that these Galileans had become sinners above all the Galileans because they suffered such things?

sinaiticus.text: I tell you no; but unless you repent, you shall all in like manner perish.

verses.text: I tell you no; but unless you repent, you shall all in like manner perish.

sinaiticus.text: Or those eighteen, on whom fell the tower in Siloam and killed them, think you that they had become debtors above all the men that dwell in Jerusalem?

verses.text: Or those eighteen, on whom fell the tower in Siloam and killed them, think you that they had become debtors above all the men that dwell in Jerusalem?

sinaiticus.text: I tell you no; but unless you repent, you shall all in like manner perish.

verses.text: I tell you no; but unless you repent, you shall all in like manner perish.

sinaiticus.text: And he spoke this parable: A certain man had a fig-tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.

verses.text: And he spoke this parable: A certain man had a fig-tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to the vinedresser: Behold, for three years I come seeking fruit on this fig-tree and find none: cut it down; why also spoils it the ground?

verses.text: And he said to the vinedresser: Behold, for three years I come seeking fruit on this fig-tree and find none: cut it down; why also spoils it the ground?

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said to him: Sir, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it and throw in manure;

verses.text: But he answered and said to him: Sir, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it and throw in manure;

sinaiticus.text: and if afterward it produce fruit; but if not, thou shalt cut it down.

verses.text: and if afterward it produce fruit; but if not, thou shalt cut it down.

sinaiticus.text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.

verses.text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, a woman that had had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years; and she was bowed together and was not able to lift herself up at all.

verses.text: And behold, a woman that had had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years; and she was bowed together and was not able to lift herself up at all.

sinaiticus.text: And seeing her, Jesus called to her and said to her: Woman, thou art loosed from thy infirmity;

verses.text: And seeing her, Jesus called to her and said to her: Woman, thou art loosed from thy infirmity;

sinaiticus.text: and he laid his hands on her; and she immediately stood erect, and glorified God.

verses.text: and he laid his hands on her; and she immediately stood erect, and glorified God.

sinaiticus.text: But the ruler of the synagogue answered, being angry because Jesus had cured on the sabbath, and said to the multitude: There are six days in which work ought to be done: on them therefore come and be cured, and not on the sabbath day.

verses.text: But the ruler of the synagogue answered, being angry because Jesus had cured on the sabbath, and said to the multitude: There are six days in which work ought to be done: on them therefore come and be cured, and not on the sabbath day.

sinaiticus.text: But the Lord answered him and said: Hypocrites, does not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall and lead him away and give him water?

verses.text: But the Lord answered him and said: Hypocrites, does not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall and lead him away and give him water?

sinaiticus.text: But this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound lo, eighteen years, ought she not to be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?

verses.text: But this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound lo, eighteen years, ought she not to be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?

sinaiticus.text: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that had been done by him.

verses.text: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that had been done by him.

sinaiticus.text: He said therefore: To what is the kingdom of God like, and to what shall I liken it?

verses.text: He said therefore: To what is the kingdom of God like, and to what shall I liken it?

sinaiticus.text: It is like a grain of mustard that a man took and threw into his garden; and it grew and became a tree, and the birds of the heaven roosted in its branches.138

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard that a man took and threw into his garden; and it grew and became a tree, and the birds of the heaven roosted in its branches.138

sinaiticus.text: And again he said: To what shall I liken the kingdom of God?

verses.text: And again he said: To what shall I liken the kingdom of God?

sinaiticus.text: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, till the whole was leavened.

verses.text: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, till the whole was leavened.

sinaiticus.text: And he passed through the cities and villages teaching and making the journey to Jerusalem.

verses.text: And he passed through the cities and villages teaching and making the journey to Jerusalem.

sinaiticus.text: And some one said to him: Lord, are they few that are saved? But he said to them:

verses.text: And some one said to him: Lord, are they few that are saved? But he said to them:

sinaiticus.text: Strive to enter in through the strait gate; for many, I say to you, will seek to enter in and shall not be able.

verses.text: Strive to enter in through the strait gate; for many, I say to you, will seek to enter in and shall not be able.

sinaiticus.text: From whatever time the master of the house shall have risen up and closed the door and you shall have begun to stand without and to knock at the door, saying: Lord, open to us, and he shall answer and say to you: I know you not whence you are:

verses.text: From whatever time the master of the house shall have risen up and closed the door and you shall have begun to stand without and to knock at the door, saying: Lord, open to us, and he shall answer and say to you: I know you not whence you are:

sinaiticus.text: then shall you begin to say: We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and in our streets hast thou taught.

verses.text: then shall you begin to say: We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and in our streets hast thou taught.

sinaiticus.text: And he will say: I tell you, I know you not whence you are: depart from me, all workers of iniquity.

verses.text: And he will say: I tell you, I know you not whence you are: depart from me, all workers of iniquity.

sinaiticus.text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but yourselves cast out.

verses.text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but yourselves cast out.

sinaiticus.text: And they shall come from east and west and north and south, and shall recline at table in the kingdom of God.

verses.text: And they shall come from east and west and north and south, and shall recline at table in the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, there are last that shall be first, and there are first that shall be last.

verses.text: And behold, there are last that shall be first, and there are first that shall be last.

sinaiticus.text: At that hour came to him some Pharisees, saying to him: Get out and depart hence, for Herod will kill thee.

verses.text: At that hour came to him some Pharisees, saying to him: Get out and depart hence, for Herod will kill thee.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Go and tell this fox: Behold, I cast out demons and perfect cures today and tomorrow, and on the third day I make an end.

verses.text: And he said to them: Go and tell this fox: Behold, I cast out demons and perfect cures today and tomorrow, and on the third day I make an end.

sinaiticus.text: But I must journey today and to-morrow and the day following; for it is not possible that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.

verses.text: But I must journey today and to-morrow and the day following; for it is not possible that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.

sinaiticus.text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killest the prophets and stonest them that are sent to thee, how often have I desired to gather thy children together as a hen her young under her wings, and you refused.

verses.text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killest the prophets and stonest them that are sent to thee, how often have I desired to gather thy children together as a hen her young under her wings, and you refused.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, your house is left to you. I say to you that you shall not see me till the time come when you shall say: Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord.

verses.text: Behold, your house is left to you. I say to you that you shall not see me till the time come when you shall say: Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass that he entered on a sabbath into the house of some one of the chief men of the Pharisees to eat bread, and they were watching him.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he entered on a sabbath into the house of some one of the chief men of the Pharisees to eat bread, and they were watching him.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying: Is it lawful to cure on the sabbath, or not? But they were silent.

verses.text: And Jesus answered and spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying: Is it lawful to cure on the sabbath, or not? But they were silent.

sinaiticus.text: And he took him and restored him to health and let him go.

verses.text: And he took him and restored him to health and let him go.

sinaiticus.text: And answering, he said to them: Shall a son or ox of any one of you fall into a pit and will he not immediately draw him out on the sabbath day?

verses.text: And answering, he said to them: Shall a son or ox of any one of you fall into a pit and will he not immediately draw him out on the sabbath day?

sinaiticus.text: And they were not able to answer him to these things.

verses.text: And they were not able to answer him to these things.

sinaiticus.text: But when he observed how they chose out the chief places, he spoke a parable to those that were called saying to them:

verses.text: But when he observed how they chose out the chief places, he spoke a parable to those that were called saying to them:

sinaiticus.text: When thou art called by any one to a marriage, do not recline on the chief place, lest a more honorable than thou may have been called by him,

verses.text: When thou art called by any one to a marriage, do not recline on the chief place, lest a more honorable than thou may have been called by him,

sinaiticus.text: and he that called thee and him shall come and say to thee: Give this man place, and then thou begin with shame to occupy the last place.

verses.text: and he that called thee and him shall come and say to thee: Give this man place, and then thou begin with shame to occupy the last place.

sinaiticus.text: But when thou art called, go and recline on the last place; that when he that called thee come, he shall say to thee: Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have honor in the presence of those that recline with thee.

verses.text: But when thou art called, go and recline on the last place; that when he that called thee come, he shall say to thee: Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have honor in the presence of those that recline with thee.

sinaiticus.text: For every one that exalts himself shall be humbled, and he that humbles himself shall be exalted.

verses.text: For every one that exalts himself shall be humbled, and he that humbles himself shall be exalted.

sinaiticus.text: And he said also to him that had called him: When thou wouldst make a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brothers, nor thy relatives, nor rich neighbors, lest they also call thee in turn, and a recompense be made thee.

verses.text: And he said also to him that had called him: When thou wouldst make a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brothers, nor thy relatives, nor rich neighbors, lest they also call thee in turn, and a recompense be made thee.

sinaiticus.text: But when thou wouldst make a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind,

verses.text: But when thou wouldst make a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind,

sinaiticus.text: and thou shalt be blessed: for they cannot recompense thee; but thou shalt have recompense in the resurrection of the just.

verses.text: and thou shalt be blessed: for they cannot recompense thee; but thou shalt have recompense in the resurrection of the just.

sinaiticus.text: And some one of those that reclined with him, hearing these things, said to him: Blessed is he that eats bread in the kingdom of God.

verses.text: And some one of those that reclined with him, hearing these things, said to him: Blessed is he that eats bread in the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to him: A certain man made a great supper and called many;

verses.text: But he said to him: A certain man made a great supper and called many;

sinaiticus.text: and sent his servant at the hour of supper to say to those that had been called: Come, for it is now prepared.

verses.text: and sent his servant at the hour of supper to say to those that had been called: Come, for it is now prepared.

sinaiticus.text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said to him: I have bought a field, and I must 1 needs go and see it: I pray thee, have me excused.

verses.text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said to him: I have bought a field, and I must 1 needs go and see it: I pray thee, have me excused.

sinaiticus.text: And another said: I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to prove them: I pray thee, have me excused.

verses.text: And another said: I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to prove them: I pray thee, have me excused.

sinaiticus.text: And another said: I have married a wife and therefore I cannot come.140

verses.text: And another said: I have married a wife and therefore I cannot come.140

sinaiticus.text: And the servant came back and reported these things to his lord. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant: Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and the poor and maimed and blind and lame bring in hither.

verses.text: And the servant came back and reported these things to his lord. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant: Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and the poor and maimed and blind and lame bring in hither.

sinaiticus.text: And the servant said: Lord, what thou didst command has been done, and yet there is room.

verses.text: And the servant said: Lord, what thou didst command has been done, and yet there is room.

sinaiticus.text: And the lord said to the servant: Go out into the roads and hedges; and compel them to come in, that my house may be full;

verses.text: And the lord said to the servant: Go out into the roads and hedges; and compel them to come in, that my house may be full;

sinaiticus.text: for I say: to you that not one of those men that have been called shall taste of my supper.

verses.text: for I say: to you that not one of those men that have been called shall taste of my supper.

sinaiticus.text: And many multitudes journeyed with him; and he turned and said to them:

verses.text: And many multitudes journeyed with him; and he turned and said to them:

sinaiticus.text: If any one comes to me and hates not his father and mother, and wife and children, and brothers and sisters, and even his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

verses.text: If any one comes to me and hates not his father and mother, and wife and children, and brothers and sisters, and even his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

sinaiticus.text: Whoever does not bear his cross and come after me cannot be my disciple.

verses.text: Whoever does not bear his cross and come after me cannot be my disciple.

sinaiticus.text: For what one of you intending to build a tower sits not down first and counts the cost, if he has enough to finish it?

verses.text: For what one of you intending to build a tower sits not down first and counts the cost, if he has enough to finish it?

sinaiticus.text: lest perhaps, after he has laid the foundation and is not able to finish, all that see begin to deride him,

verses.text: lest perhaps, after he has laid the foundation and is not able to finish, all that see begin to deride him,

sinaiticus.text: saying: This man began to build and was not able to finish.

verses.text: saying: This man began to build and was not able to finish.

sinaiticus.text: Or what king going to engage in battle with another king, will not sit down first and deliberate whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him that comes against him with twenty thousand?

verses.text: Or what king going to engage in battle with another king, will not sit down first and deliberate whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him that comes against him with twenty thousand?

sinaiticus.text: But if not, while he is yet far off, he sends an embassy and asks conditions of peace.

verses.text: But if not, while he is yet far off, he sends an embassy and asks conditions of peace.

sinaiticus.text: So then, no one of you that forsakes not all that he has can be my disciple.

verses.text: So then, no one of you that forsakes not all that he has can be my disciple.

sinaiticus.text: Salt then is good; but if the salt become tasteless, by what means shall it be seasoned?

verses.text: Salt then is good; but if the salt become tasteless, by what means shall it be seasoned?

sinaiticus.text: It is fit neither for earth nor for manure: they cast it out. He that has ears, let him hear.

verses.text: It is fit neither for earth nor for manure: they cast it out. He that has ears, let him hear.

sinaiticus.text: And all the publicans and the sinners were drawing near to him to hear him.

verses.text: And all the publicans and the sinners were drawing near to him to hear him.

sinaiticus.text: And both the Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying: This man receives sinners and eats with them.

verses.text: And both the Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying: This man receives sinners and eats with them.

sinaiticus.text: But he spoke to them this parable, saying:

verses.text: But he spoke to them this parable, saying:

sinaiticus.text: What man of you, that has a hundred sheep, and loses one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after that

verses.text: What man of you, that has a hundred sheep, and loses one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after that

sinaiticus.text: And when he finds it, he lays it on his shoulder rejoicing;

verses.text: And when he finds it, he lays it on his shoulder rejoicing;

sinaiticus.text: and having come home, he calls together the friends and the neighbors, saying to them: Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep that was lost.

verses.text: and having come home, he calls together the friends and the neighbors, saying to them: Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep that was lost.

sinaiticus.text: I say to you that so there shall be joy in heaven over one sinner that repents, more than over ninety-nine righteous who have no need of repentance.

verses.text: I say to you that so there shall be joy in heaven over one sinner that repents, more than over ninety-nine righteous who have no need of repentance.

sinaiticus.text: Or what woman having ten drachmas, if she lose one drachma, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and seek carefully till she find it?

verses.text: Or what woman having ten drachmas, if she lose one drachma, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and seek carefully till she find it?

sinaiticus.text: And when she has found it, she calls together the friends and neighbors, saying: Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma that I lost.

verses.text: And when she has found it, she calls together the friends and neighbors, saying: Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma that I lost.

sinaiticus.text: So, I say to you, there arises joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repents.

verses.text: So, I say to you, there arises joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repents.

sinaiticus.text: And he said: A certain man had two sons.

verses.text: And he said: A certain man had two sons.

sinaiticus.text: And the younger of them said to the father: Father, give me the part of the estate that falls to me. And he divided to them the living.

verses.text: And the younger of them said to the father: Father, give me the part of the estate that falls to me. And he divided to them the living.

sinaiticus.text: And not many days after, the younger son gathered all together and went from home into a distant country, and there wasted his estate by riotous living.

verses.text: And not many days after, the younger son gathered all together and went from home into a distant country, and there wasted his estate by riotous living.

sinaiticus.text: But when he had spent all, there arose a great famine throughout that land, and he began to be in want.

verses.text: But when he had spent all, there arose a great famine throughout that land, and he began to be in want.

sinaiticus.text: And he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed swine;

verses.text: And he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed swine;

sinaiticus.text: and he desired to fill his belly with the pods that the swine did eat; and no one gave to him.

verses.text: and he desired to fill his belly with the pods that the swine did eat; and no one gave to him.

sinaiticus.text: But having come to himself, he said: How many hired servants of my father have bread enough and to spare; but I am perishing here with hunger.

verses.text: But having come to himself, he said: How many hired servants of my father have bread enough and to spare; but I am perishing here with hunger.

sinaiticus.text: I will arise and go to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and in thy sight;

verses.text: I will arise and go to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and in thy sight;

sinaiticus.text: no longer am I worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

verses.text: no longer am I worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

sinaiticus.text: And he arose and came to his father. And while he was yet a great way off, his father saw him and had pity on him; and running, he fell upon his neck and kissed him.

verses.text: And he arose and came to his father. And while he was yet a great way off, his father saw him and had pity on him; and running, he fell upon his neck and kissed him.

sinaiticus.text: And the son said to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and in thy sight; no longer am I worthy to be called thy son.

verses.text: And the son said to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and in thy sight; no longer am I worthy to be called thy son.

sinaiticus.text: But the father said to his servants: Bring forth the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand, and sandals on his feet;

verses.text: But the father said to his servants: Bring forth the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand, and sandals on his feet;

sinaiticus.text: and bring the fatted calf, kill, and let us eat and be merry;

verses.text: and bring the fatted calf, kill, and let us eat and be merry;

sinaiticus.text: for this, my son, was dead and lives again, was lost and is found. And they began to be merry.142

verses.text: for this, my son, was dead and lives again, was lost and is found. And they began to be merry.142

sinaiticus.text: But his older son was in the field; and when he came and drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing;

verses.text: But his older son was in the field; and when he came and drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing;

sinaiticus.text: and calling to him one of the servants, he inquired what these things meant.

verses.text: and calling to him one of the servants, he inquired what these things meant.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to him: Thy brother has come, and thy father has killed the fatted calf, because he has received him in health.

verses.text: And he said to him: Thy brother has come, and thy father has killed the fatted calf, because he has received him in health.

sinaiticus.text: But he was angry, and would not go in; and his father came out and entreated him.

verses.text: But he was angry, and would not go in; and his father came out and entreated him.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said to the father: Behold, so many years do I serve thee, and at no time have I transgressed thy commandment; and yet to me thou hast at no time given a kid that I might make merry with my friends;

verses.text: But he answered and said to the father: Behold, so many years do I serve thee, and at no time have I transgressed thy commandment; and yet to me thou hast at no time given a kid that I might make merry with my friends;

sinaiticus.text: but when thy son, this that has eaten up thy living with harlots, came, thou didst kill for him the fatted calf.

verses.text: but when thy son, this that has eaten up thy living with harlots, came, thou didst kill for him the fatted calf.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to him: Son, thou art always with me, and all mine is thine;

verses.text: But he said to him: Son, thou art always with me, and all mine is thine;

sinaiticus.text: but to make merry and to be glad was needful, for this thy brother was dead and lives again; was lost and is found.

verses.text: but to make merry and to be glad was needful, for this thy brother was dead and lives again; was lost and is found.

sinaiticus.text: And he said also to the disciples: There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and he was accused to him of wasting his goods.

verses.text: And he said also to the disciples: There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and he was accused to him of wasting his goods.

sinaiticus.text: And he called him and said to him: What is this that I hear of thee? Give an account of thy stewardship; for thou canst no longer act as steward.

verses.text: And he called him and said to him: What is this that I hear of thee? Give an account of thy stewardship; for thou canst no longer act as steward.

sinaiticus.text: And the steward said within himself: What shall I do? for my lord takes from me the stewardship. To dig I am not able, to beg I am ashamed.

verses.text: And the steward said within himself: What shall I do? for my lord takes from me the stewardship. To dig I am not able, to beg I am ashamed.

sinaiticus.text: I have found what I shall do, that when I am put out of the stewardship they may receive me into their houses.

verses.text: I have found what I shall do, that when I am put out of the stewardship they may receive me into their houses.

sinaiticus.text: And calling to him each one of his lord’s debtors, he said to the first: How much owest thou my lord?

verses.text: And calling to him each one of his lord’s debtors, he said to the first: How much owest thou my lord?

sinaiticus.text: He said: A hundred baths of oil. And he said to him: Take back thy note, and sit down quickly and write fifty.

verses.text: He said: A hundred baths of oil. And he said to him: Take back thy note, and sit down quickly and write fifty.

sinaiticus.text: Then he said to another: And how much owest thou? And he said: A hundred homers of wheat. He says to him: Take back thy note, and write eighty.

verses.text: Then he said to another: And how much owest thou? And he said: A hundred homers of wheat. He says to him: Take back thy note, and write eighty.

sinaiticus.text: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had acted prudently; for the children of this age are, in reference to their generation, wiser than the children of light.

verses.text: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had acted prudently; for the children of this age are, in reference to their generation, wiser than the children of light.

sinaiticus.text: And I say to you: Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness, that when it fails they may receive you into the

verses.text: And I say to you: Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness, that when it fails they may receive you into the

sinaiticus.text: He that is faithful in very little is faithful also in much, and he that is unjust in very little is unjust also in much.

verses.text: He that is faithful in very little is faithful also in much, and he that is unjust in very little is unjust also in much.

sinaiticus.text: If then you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will entrust to you the true riches?

verses.text: If then you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will entrust to you the true riches?

sinaiticus.text: And if you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give to you that which is your own?

verses.text: And if you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give to you that which is your own?

sinaiticus.text: No servant can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other; or he will hold the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other; or he will hold the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.

sinaiticus.text: And the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things, and scoffed at him.

verses.text: And the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things, and scoffed at him.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: You are they that justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts; for that which is highly esteemed among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

verses.text: And he said to them: You are they that justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts; for that which is highly esteemed among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

sinaiticus.text: The law and the prophets preached till John; from that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every one enters it by force.

verses.text: The law and the prophets preached till John; from that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every one enters it by force.

sinaiticus.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one point of the law to fall.

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one point of the law to fall.

sinaiticus.text: Every one that puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery, and he that marries her that is put away from a husband commits adultery.

verses.text: Every one that puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery, and he that marries her that is put away from a husband commits adultery.

sinaiticus.text: But there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, feasting splendidly every day.

verses.text: But there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, feasting splendidly every day.

sinaiticus.text: And a certain poor man named Lazarus had been laid at his gate, full of sores,

verses.text: And a certain poor man named Lazarus had been laid at his gate, full of sores,

sinaiticus.text: and desiring to be fed with that which fell from the rich man’s table: moreover, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

verses.text: and desiring to be fed with that which fell from the rich man’s table: moreover, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

sinaiticus.text: But it came to pass that the poor man died and was carried by angels to Abraham’s bosom; and the rich man also died and was buried.

verses.text: But it came to pass that the poor man died and was carried by angels to Abraham’s bosom; and the rich man also died and was buried.

sinaiticus.text: And in hades he lifted up his eyes, being in torments, and saw Abraham afar off and Lazarus in his bosom.

verses.text: And in hades he lifted up his eyes, being in torments, and saw Abraham afar off and Lazarus in his bosom.

sinaiticus.text: And he cried and said: Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am tormented in this flame.

verses.text: And he cried and said: Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am tormented in this flame.

sinaiticus.text: But Abraham said: Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and Lazarus likewise evil things; but now here he is comforted and thou art tormented.

verses.text: But Abraham said: Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and Lazarus likewise evil things; but now here he is comforted and thou art tormented.

sinaiticus.text: And in all these regions between us and you a great chasm is fixed, so that they that would pass hence to you cannot, neither can they pass thence to us.

verses.text: And in all these regions between us and you a great chasm is fixed, so that they that would pass hence to you cannot, neither can they pass thence to us.

sinaiticus.text: And he said: I pray thee then, father, that thou wouldst send him to my father’s house;144

verses.text: And he said: I pray thee then, father, that thou wouldst send him to my father’s house;144

sinaiticus.text: for I have five brothers: that he may earnestly testify to them, lest they themselves also come to this place of torment.

verses.text: for I have five brothers: that he may earnestly testify to them, lest they themselves also come to this place of torment.

sinaiticus.text: But Abraham said to him: They have Moses and the prophets: let them hear them.

verses.text: But Abraham said to him: They have Moses and the prophets: let them hear them.

sinaiticus.text: And he said: No, father Abraham; but if one from the dead should go to them, they will repent.

verses.text: And he said: No, father Abraham; but if one from the dead should go to them, they will repent.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to him: If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded though one should rise from the dead.

verses.text: But he said to him: If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded though one should rise from the dead.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to his disciples: It is impossible that offenses come not; but alas for him through whom they come:

verses.text: And he said to his disciples: It is impossible that offenses come not; but alas for him through whom they come:

sinaiticus.text: it were better for him that an upper millstone were hung about his neck and he thrown into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.

verses.text: it were better for him that an upper millstone were hung about his neck and he thrown into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed to yourselves. If thy brother sin, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

verses.text: Take heed to yourselves. If thy brother sin, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

sinaiticus.text: And if he sin against thee seven times in a day, and seven times turn to thee, saying: I repent, thou shalt forgive him.

verses.text: And if he sin against thee seven times in a day, and seven times turn to thee, saying: I repent, thou shalt forgive him.

sinaiticus.text: And the apostles said to the Lord: Increase our faith.

verses.text: And the apostles said to the Lord: Increase our faith.

sinaiticus.text: But the Lord said: If you have faith as a grain of mustard, you might say to this sycamine tree: Be uprooted and be planted in the sea, and it would obey you.

verses.text: But the Lord said: If you have faith as a grain of mustard, you might say to this sycamine tree: Be uprooted and be planted in the sea, and it would obey you.

sinaiticus.text: But which of you in having a servant plowing or feeding a flock, will say to him when he comes from the field: Come immediately and recline at table?

verses.text: But which of you in having a servant plowing or feeding a flock, will say to him when he comes from the field: Come immediately and recline at table?

sinaiticus.text: But will he not say to him: Make ready my supper, and gird thyself and serve me till I eat and drink, and after this thou shalt eat and drink?

verses.text: But will he not say to him: Make ready my supper, and gird thyself and serve me till I eat and drink, and after this thou shalt eat and drink?

sinaiticus.text: Does he thank the servant because he did the things that were commanded?

verses.text: Does he thank the servant because he did the things that were commanded?

sinaiticus.text: So also you, when you shall have done all things that are commanded you, say that we are unprofitable servants; we have done what we ought to have done.

verses.text: So also you, when you shall have done all things that are commanded you, say that we are unprofitable servants; we have done what we ought to have done.

verses.text: And it came to pass as he journeyed to Jerusalem, he also went through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

verses.text: And as he entered a certain village there met him ten leprous men, who stood afar off;

verses.text: and they lifted up their voices, saying: Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

sinaiticus.text: And seeing, he said to them: Go, show yourselves to the priests. And it came to pass as they went they were cleansed.

sinaiticus.text: For as the lightning flashing out from one place under heaven shines to the other place under heaven, so shall the Son of man be in his day.

sinaiticus.text: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected by this generation.

sinaiticus.text: They were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were giving in marriage till the day on which Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed all.

sinaiticus.text: saying: There was in a city a judge that feared not God, and regarded not man.

sinaiticus.text: And there was a widow in that city, and she came to him, saying: Avenge me, on my opponent-at-law.

sinaiticus.text: I say to you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless will the Son of man, when he comes, find the faith on the earth?

sinaiticus.text: And he spoke also this parable to some that trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

verses.text: And he spoke also this parable to some that trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

sinaiticus.text: Two men went up into the temple to pray, the one a Pharisee and the other a publican.

verses.text: Two men went up into the temple to pray, the one a Pharisee and the other a publican.

sinaiticus.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus: God, I thank thee that I am not as the rest of men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus: God, I thank thee that I am not as the rest of men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

sinaiticus.text: I fast twice in the week, I pay tithes of all that I possess.

verses.text: I fast twice in the week, I pay tithes of all that I possess.

sinaiticus.text: But the publican, standing far off, would not lift even his eyes to heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying: God, be merciful to me the sinner.

sinaiticus.text: I say to you, this man went down to his house justified rather indeed than the other; for every one that exalts himself shall be humbled, but he that humbles himself shall be exalted.

verses.text: for the Son of man has come to seek and save the lost.

sinaiticus.text: And as they heard these things he also spoke a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and they thought that the kingdom of God would immediately appear.

verses.text: And as they heard these things he also spoke a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and they thought that the kingdom of God would immediately appear.

sinaiticus.text: He said, therefore: A nobleman went into a distant country, to receive for himself a kingdom, and return.

verses.text: He said, therefore: A nobleman went into a distant country, to receive for himself a kingdom, and return.

sinaiticus.text: And he called his ten servants and gave to them ten pounds, and said to them: Engage in trade till I come.

verses.text: And he called his ten servants and gave to them ten pounds, and said to them: Engage in trade till I come.

sinaiticus.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an embassy after him, saying: We are not willing that this man shall reign over us.

verses.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an embassy after him, saying: We are not willing that this man shall reign over us.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass when he had returned, having received the kingdom, he also ordered that those servants to whom he had given the money should be called to him, that he might know what each had gained by trading.

verses.text: And it came to pass when he had returned, having received the kingdom, he also ordered that those servants to whom he had given the money should be called to him, that he might know what each had gained by trading.

verses.text: And the first came to him, saying: Lord, thy pound has gained ten pounds.
